ACT
28
Annulment of the will due to defects in the will of the testator
Annulment of the will or some of its provisions due to threat or force, fraud or misrepresentation can only be requested by a person who has a legal interest in it, and within one year from the time he became aware of the existence of the cause of invalidity, but within ten years at the latest from the promulgation of the will.
The period of one year cannot begin to run before the promulgation of the will.
According to the person who caused the defects of the testator's will, or knew about them or should have known about them, the annulment of the will can be requested within 20 years from the date of promulgation of the will.
